title: Extends provisions of rent control law

BILL NUMBER:S2744

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend chapter 576 of the laws of 1974 amending the emergency housing
rent control law relating to the control of and stabilization of rent in
certain cases, the emergency housing rent control law, chapter 329 of the
laws of 1963 amending the emergency housing rent control law relating to
recontrol of rents in Albany, chapter 555 of the laws of 1982 amending
the general business law and the administrative code of the city of New
York relating to conversion of residential  property to cooperative or
condominium ownership in the city of New York, chapter 402 of the laws
of 1983 amending the general business law relating to conversions of
rental residential property to cooperative or condominium ownership in
certain municipalities in the counties of Nassau, Westchester and
Rockland and the rent regulation reform act of 1997, in relation to
extending the period of effectiveness thereof

PURPOSE:

This bill would extend the period during which provisions of various
laws that regulate rental housing will remain in force. These laws
are currently scheduled to expire on June 15, 2011; under this bill
they would expire on June 15, 2014.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:

Section 1 of the bill amends section 17 of chapter 576 of the laws of
1974, as amended by chapter 82 of the laws of 2003, to extend the
period certain provisions of law will remain in force to June IS, 2014.

Section 2 of the bill amends subdivision 2 of section 1 of chapter 274
of the laws of 1946, as amended by chapter 82 of the laws of 2003, to
extend the period certain provisions of law will remain in force to
June IS, 2014.

Section 3 of the bill amends section 2 of chapter 329 of the laws of
1963, as amended by chapter 82 of the laws of 2003, to extend the
period certain provisions of law will remain in force to June IS, 2014.

Section 4 of the bill amends section 10 of chapter 555 of the laws of
1982, as amended by chapter 82 of the laws of 2003, to extend the
period certain provisions of law will remain in force to June IS, 2014.

Section 5 of the bill amends section 4 of chapter 402 of the laws of
1983, as amended by chapter 82 of the laws of 2003, to extend the
period certain provisions of law will remain in force to June 15, 2014.

Section 6 of the bill amends subdivision 6 of section 46 of chapter
116 of the laws of 1997, as amended by chapter 82 of the laws of

2003, to extend the period certain provisions of law will remain in
force to June 15, 2014.

Section 7 of the bill sets forth its effective date.

JUSTIFICATION:

The rental housing markets in areas subject to the various laws that
regulate rental housing remain extremely competitive, and are
projected to remain so into the foreseeable future. For example,
according to a report recently issued by the real estate research
company Reis, Inc., the vacancy rate of apartments in New York City
was less than three percent in 2009, while the U.S. Census Bureau
Current Estimates Program has determined that the population of the
City continues to grow. These conditions encourage price inflation in
the rental housing market and weaken tenants' bargaining positions
relative to their landlords.

Meanwhile, key provisions of the law regulating rent and other aspects
of the rental housing market are set to expire on June 15, 2011. This
bill extends those expiration dates to June 15, 2014.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2009/2010-Senate and Assembly referred to housing.

FISCAL IMPACT:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
